benchmark_details.name: Dynabench
benchmark_details.overview: Dynabench is an open-source platform for dynamic dataset creation and model benchmarking which allows dataset creation, model development, and model assessment to inform each other, leading to more robust and informative benchmarks.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a platform for dynamic benchmarking that allows for a continuous cycle of data collection and model evaluation to address the shortcomings of traditional static benchmarks.

data.source: Various sources including crowd-sourced annotations and existing datasets like SQuAD and ANLI.

methodology.calculation: The ratio of human-validated model errors to total examples.
methodology.interpretation: Lower vMER indicates better model performance when interacting with humans.
methodology.baseline_results: Initial vMERs vary by task: NLI 33.24%, QA 33.74%, Sentiment 35.00%, Hate speech 43.90%
methodology.validation: Multiple rounds of data collection and validation via human assessment.
